workflow.title: Flight Preparation
workflow.intro: This guide describes the recommended workflow before starting a flight in MSFS 2024 Career Mode.
workflow.step1Text: Open Career Mode in MSFS 2024 and select a flight.
workflow.step1ImportantText: Choose a flight whose departure airport is where your aircraft is currently located.
workflow.step1Tip: This way you avoid unnecessary repositioning costs and start directly at the gate.
workflow.step2Text: Open the MSFS Flight Planner and create a new route for your flight.
workflow.step2WarningText: The automatically generated in-game routes often have errors in the approach (wrong approaches, missing waypoints). The external planner creates more reliable flight routes.
workflow.step3Text: Save the route in Flight Planner and load it in MSFS. You can export the route directly from the planner or enter it manually into the MCDU.
workflow.step4Text: Now you're ready! Switch to Career Mode in this app and work through the checklist from top to bottom.
workflow.step4Tip: With the SimConnect Bridge, many items are automatically verified.

news.title: News & Info
news.welcomeText: This checklist app was developed for MSFS 2024 and helps you navigate through all flight phases in a structured way.
news.storageText: Your progress is stored locally in your browser (LocalStorage). No data is sent to servers - everything stays on your device.

bridge.title: SimConnect Bridge
bridge.whatIsText: The SimConnect Bridge connects this web app with Microsoft Flight Simulator. It reads cockpit states and automatically shows whether checklist items are correctly set.
bridge.requirementsText: Before you can use the Bridge, you need two things: The MSFS 2024 SDK (for the SimConnect library) and the Bridge software from the GitHub repository.
bridge.sdkStep1: Open the Microsoft Store on your PC
bridge.sdkStep2: Search for "MSFS 2024 SDK" or "Flight Simulator SDK"
bridge.sdkStep4: After installation, you'll find the SDK at:
bridge.sdkNote: The important file is SimConnect.dll - this is required by the Bridge.
bridge.downloadText: Download or clone the repository from GitHub:
bridge.downloadStep1: Go to GitHub and click 'Code' > 'Download ZIP'
bridge.downloadStep3: Extract the ZIP to a folder of your choice
bridge.installStep1: Open a Command Prompt (CMD) or PowerShell
bridge.installNote: The Bridge must be running before you start MSFS, or while MSFS is already running. You need .NET 7 SDK installed.
bridge.connectionText: Once the Bridge is running and MSFS is started, the Bridge connects automatically. You can see the status at the top of this app.
bridge.connectionTip: It's best to start the Bridge before starting MSFS. The Bridge automatically detects when MSFS starts.
bridge.autoCheckText: When the Bridge is connected, a colored dot appears next to items:
bridge.troubleConnectionTip1: Check if MSFS 2024 is running (not MSFS 2020)
bridge.troubleConnectionTip3: Check if the SDK is installed correctly
bridge.troubleSdkTip1: Install the SDK via Microsoft Store
bridge.troubleSdkTip2: Check the installation path (default: C:\MSFS SDK)
